result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Adrew J. Terry not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court she has not completed review of the discovery; further, she has not yet met with defendant to convey State's offer and requests adjournment for further scheduling.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court (appears in person), defendant Adrew J. Terry not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin (via telephone conference).
Defense counsel advises that she is resuming trial on an unrelated case in another court and requests off the record adjournment; no objection by the State.
Case is adjourned for further scheduling in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Adrew J. Terry in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Adrew J. Terry in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrew J. Terry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Motion to modify No Contact Order.  Arguments heard.  Court denies defense's motion.  Defense counsel requests scheduling conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Adrew J. Terry in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn; both appear by video.  Defendant Adrew J. Terry in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adrew J. Terry in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Adrew J. Terry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
